quote_first: Hugo Carmody had done this, with the result that by
quote_last: he was feeling as if he had been marooned among roses since the beginning of summer.
title: Summer Lightning
author: P.G. Wodehouse

quote_first: He would make his way by charm, the charm of voice, of jewel-like language, above all by the intellectual charm of new, moving, luminous ideas. At
quote_last: the doctor closed the book and waited.
title: The Drunkard
author: Guy Thorne
